g.text: Climate-Glucose Metabolism: XGBoost Model Analysis and Temporal Patterns
Machine Learning Analysis of Climate-Glucose Relationships
XGBoost Model Performance and Feature Importance Analysis
Temporal Pattern Analysis: Multi-day Climate Effects
• 7-day temperature minimum shows strongest climate signal (5.45% importance)
• Multi-week temperature extremes (14-day max/min) show substantial effects
• Short-term patterns (3-5 days) capture acute physiological responses
• Heating degree days suggest cold stress also affects glucose metabolism
• Hours 0-24: Acute stress response, cortisol elevation
• Days 1-3: Dehydration effects, blood glucose concentration
• Days 7-14: Chronic stress, insulin resistance development

SCIENTIFIC ASSESSMENT: XGBoost model explains 28.9% of glucose variance (moderate-strong effect) • Demographics dominate climate signals • Multi-day temperature patterns show biologically plausible lag effects • Results support climate-metabolic health hypotheses
